net.openhft.chronicle.core

Enum Jvm

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<Jvm>
      • net.openhft.chronicle.core.Jvm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<Jvm>

    public enum Jvm
extends Enum<Jvm>
    Utility class to access information in the JVM.

    System.out.println(c);

        public static int compileThreshold()
        Returns the compile threshold for the JVM or else an estimate thereof (e.g. 10_000).

        The compile threshold can be explicitly set using the command line parameter "-XX:CompileThreshold="

        Returns:

      • pause

        public static void pause(long durationMs)
        Silently pause for the provided durationMs milliseconds.

        If the provided durationMs is positive, then the current thread sleeps.

        If the provided durationMs is zero, then the current thread yields.

        Parameters:
        durationMs - to sleep for.

      • nanoPause

        public static void nanoPause()
        Pause in a busy loop for a very short time.

      • busyWaitMicros

        public static void busyWaitMicros(long durationUs)
        Pause in a busy loop for the provided durationUs microseconds.

        This method is designed to be used when the time to be waited is very small, typically under a millisecond (@{code durationUs < 1_000}).

        Parameters:
        durationUs - Time in durationUs

      • busyWaitUntil

        public static void busyWaitUntil(long waitUntilNs)
        Pauses the current thread in a busy loop until the provided waitUntilNs time is reached.

        This method is designed to be used when the time to be waited is very small, typically under a millisecond (@{code durationNs < 1_000_000}).

        Parameters:
        waitUntilNs - nanosecond precision counter value to await.

      • setAccessible

        public static void setAccessible(@NotNull
                                 @NotNull AccessibleObject accessibleObject)
        Set the accessible flag for the provided accessibleObject indicating that the reflected object should suppress Java language access checking when it is used.

        The setting of the accessible flag might be subject to security manager approval.

        Parameters:
        accessibleObject - to modify
        Throws:
        SecurityException - – if the request is denied.
        See Also:
        SecurityManager.checkPermission(java.security.Permission), RuntimePermission

      • getValue

        @Nullable
public static <V> V getValue(@NotNull
                                       @NotNull Object target,
                                       @NotNull
                                       @NotNull String fieldName)
        Returns the value of the provided fieldName extracted from the provided target.

        The provided fieldName can denote fields of arbitrary depth (e.g. foo.bar.baz, whereby the foo value will be extracted from the provided target and then the bar value will be extracted from the foo value and so on).

        Type Parameters:
        V - return type
        Parameters:
        target - used for extraction
        fieldName - denoting the field(s) to extract
        Returns:
        the value of the provided fieldName extracted from the provided target

        Returns:
        the lock.toString plus a stack trace.

      • usedDirectMemory

        public static long usedDirectMemory()

        (i.e. ever allocated via ByteBuffer.allocateDirect())

        Returns:
        the accumulated amount of memory in bytes used by direct ByteBuffers or 0 if the value cannot be determined

      • signalHandler

        public static void signalHandler(sun.misc.SignalHandler signalHandler)
        Adds the provided signalHandler to an internal chain of handlers that will be invoked upon detecting system signals (e.g. HUP, INT, TERM).

        Not all signals are available on all operating systems.

        Parameters:
        signalHandler - to call on a signal

      • dontChain

        public static boolean dontChain(Class<?> tClass)

      • isResourceTracing

        public static boolean isResourceTracing()
        Returns if certain chronicle resources (such as memory regions) are traced.

        Tracing resources incurs slightly less performance but provides a means of detecting proper release of resources.

        Returns:
        if certain chronicle resources (such as memory regions) are traced

      • getBoolean

        public static boolean getBoolean(String systemPropertyKey)
        Returns if a System Property with the provided systemPropertyKey either exists, is set to "yes" or is set to "true".

        This provides a more permissive boolean System systemPropertyKey flag where -Dflag -Dflag=true -Dflag=yes are all accepted.

        Parameters:
        systemPropertyKey - name to lookup
        Returns:
        if a System Property with the provided systemPropertyKey either exists, is set to "yes" or is set to "true"

      • getBoolean

        public static boolean getBoolean(String systemPropertyKey,
                                 boolean defaultValue)
        Returns if a System Property with the provided systemPropertyKey either exists, is set to "yes" or is set to "true" or, if it does not exist, returns the provided defaultValue.

        This provides a more permissive boolean System systemPropertyKey flag where -Dflag -Dflag=true -Dflag=yes are all accepted.

        Parameters:
        systemPropertyKey - name to lookup
        defaultValue - value to be used if unknown
        Returns:
        if a System Property with the provided systemPropertyKey either exists, is set to "yes" or is set to "true" or, if it does not exist, returns the provided defaultValue.

      • parseSize

        public static long parseSize(@NotNull
                             @NotNull String value)
                      throws IllegalArgumentException
        Parse a string as a decimal memory size with an optional scale. K/k = * 210, M/m = 220, G/g = 210, T/t = 240

        trailing B/b/iB/ib are ignored.

        100100 bytes
        100b100 bytes
        0.5kb512 bytes
        0.125MB128 KiB
        2M2 MiB
        0.75GiB768 MiB
        0.001TiB1.024 GiB

        Parameters:
        value - size to parse
        Returns:
        the size
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the string could be parsed

      • getSize

        public static long getSize(String property,
                           long defaultValue)
        Uses Jvm.parseSize to parse a system property or returns defaultValue if not present, empty or unparseable.
        Parameters:
        property - to look up
        defaultValue - to use otherwise
        Returns:
        the size in bytes as a long

      • address

        public static long address(@NotNull
                           @NotNull ByteBuffer byteBuffer)
        Returns the native address of the provided byteBuffer.

        Use with caution!. Native address should always be carefully guarded to prevent unspecified results or even JVM crashes.

        Parameters:
        byteBuffer - from which to extract the native address
        Returns:
        the native address of the provided byteBuffer

      • arrayByteBaseOffset

        public static int arrayByteBaseOffset()
        Returns the array byte base offset used by this JVM.

        The value is the number of bytes that precedes the actual memory layout of a byte[] array in a java array object.

        Use with caution!. Native address should always be carefully guarded to prevent unspecified results or even JVM crashes.

        Returns:
        the array byte base offset used by this JVM

      • doNotCloseOnInterrupt

        public static void doNotCloseOnInterrupt(Class<?> clazz,
                                         FileChannel fc)
        Employs a best-effort of preventing the provided fc from being automatically closed whenever the current thread gets interrupted.

        If the effort failed, the provided clazz is used for logging purposes.

        Parameters:
        clazz - to use for logging should the effort fail.
        fc - to prevent from automatically closing upon interrupt.

      • addToClassPath

        public static void addToClassPath(@NotNull
                                  @NotNull Class<?> clazz)
        Ensures that all the jars and other resources are added to the class path of the classloader associated by the provided clazz.
        Parameters:
        clazz - to use as a template.

      • getDouble

        public static double getDouble(String systemPropertyKey,
                               double defaultValue)
        Returns the System Property associated with the provided systemPropertyKey parsed as a double or, if no such parsable System Property exists, returns the provided defaultValue.
        Parameters:
        systemPropertyKey - to lookup in the System Properties
        defaultValue - to be used if no parsable key association exists
        Returns:
        the System Property associated with the provided systemPropertyKey parsed as a double or, if no such parsable System Property exists, returns the provided defaultValue

      • isProcessAlive

        public static boolean isProcessAlive(long pid)
        Returns if a process with the provided pid process id is alive.
        Parameters:
        pid - the process id (pid) of the process to check
        Returns:
        if a process with the provided pid process id is alive

      • isAzulZing

        public static boolean isAzulZing()

      • objectHeaderSize

        public static int objectHeaderSize()
